document.title: Primitives
document.paragraph:
All Vision2 primitives inherit ../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/EV_PRIMITIVE_chart.htmlEV_PRIMITIVE.
2What is a primitive? A primitive is a Vision2 widget that may not contain other widgets. Primitives may be placed in
../10_containers/index.xml containers , but a
../index.xml widget may not contain any child widgets. Some examples of primitives are ../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/EV_BUTTON_chart.htmlEV_BUTTON and ../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/EV_LABEL_chart.htmlEV_LABEL. A list of all the classes in the primitives cluster may be found
/libraries/vision2/reference/interface/widgets/primitives/index.xml here .
2Features of a primitive
All primitives inherit from ../../../reference/interface/properties/EV_TOOLTIPABLE_chart.htmlEV_TOOLTIPABLE and therefore can have tooltips assigned to them. They all inherit many features from ../../../reference/interface/widgets/EV_WIDGET_chart.htmlEV_WIDGET Each descendent of ../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/EV_PRIMITIVE_chart.htmlEV_PRIMITIVE will typically have many available features, specific to their type. For example, ../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/EV_SEPARATOR_chart.htmlEV_SEPARATOR has no extra features, but ../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/EV_LABEL_chart.htmlEV_LABEL has features for modifying the current font and also the text to de displayed.
2Widgets as item holders
Although no primitive can contain another widget, certain primitives may contain one or more
../../20_items/index.xml items . One example of this is an
../../../reference/interface/widgets/primitives/ev_list_chart.xml EV_LIST containing
../../../reference/interface/items/ev_list_item_chart.xml EV_LIST_ITEM s.
